sys_update_xml.name: kb_knowledge_block_f787309613b80010579076076144b0fc
sys_update_xml.payload:
truef787309613b80010579076076144b0fctext6816f79cc0a8016401c5a33be04be441falsetruetruefalseKBB0010002 v1.0falsefb0330019f22120047a2d126c42e70e5bb0370019f22120047a2d126c42e7073trueSample Knowledge Block - Reusable Content Here's any idea for any sort ofinformation to reuse acrossKBB00100022019-10-31Sample Knowledge Block - Reusable Content90b7b09613b80010579076076144b0abkb_knowledge_blockadmin2019-10-31 21:35:12global/f787309613b80010579076076144b0fc5admin2019-10-31 23:30:091Sample Knowledge Block - Reusable Content

Here's any idea for any sort of information to reuse across multiple articles: use a Knowledge Block. Your knowledge blocks can be placed on one or many articles with or without HR Criteria to restrict who can see the information. This is useful when you want to have one source of truth to manage the information but multiple places where you want this information to appear.  As an example, this knowledge block does not have any additional criteria that restricts who sees it, but we've reused it in a couple of articles.

]]>General02100-01-014002d55e13f80010579076076144b00fpublished

sys_update_xml.name: m2m_kb_to_block_history_ff1f3a0c13098410579076076144b02d
sys_update_xml.payload: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update table="m2m_kb_to_block_history"><m2m_kb_to_block_history action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><article_drafted>2019-11-06 17:56:17</article_drafted><article_outdated/><article_published>2019-11-06 17:56:22</article_published><article_retired/><article_state>published</article_state><block_count>1</block_count><block_outdated/><block_published>2019-11-06 17:56:17</block_published><block_retired/><block_state>published</block_state><knowledge display_value="KB0010003">91dcbe8813098410579076076144b07e</knowledge><knowledge_block display_value="KBB0010003">42d7b09613b80010579076076144b0d5</knowledge_block><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2019-11-06 17:56:17</sys_created_on><sys_id>ff1f3a0c13098410579076076144b02d</sys_id><sys_mod_count>1</sys_mod_count><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2019-11-06 17:56:22</sys_updated_on></m2m_kb_to_block_history></record_update>

sys_update_xml.name: kb_knowledge_91dcbe8813098410579076076144b07e
sys_update_xml.payload:
true91dcbe8813098410579076076144b07etext6816f79cc0a8016401c5a33be04be441falsefalsefalsefalseKB0010003 v1.0falsebb0370019f22120047a2d126c42e7073truefaq, frequently_asked_questions, common_questions, faq_sample, knowledge_sample, sample_faq, questions_and_answers, sample_articleHow should I use this type of article? Use this format of a knowledge article when you have a topic withKB00100032019-11-06FAQ Knowledge Sample8ccef60c13098410579076076144b0f3kb_knowledgeadmin2019-11-06 17:54:39global/91dcbe8813098410579076076144b07e6admin2019-11-06 18:07:203How should I use this type of article?

Use this format of a knowledge article when you have a topic with a collection of several smaller questions to provide answers to. Common reasons to use this format would be questions accompanying a policy, where the policy maybe a much longer, official document. Using questions and answers format, you can address some of the most common questions that employees have in plain language as an accompaniment to other knowledge articles or documents.

You may want some introductory content at the top of the article for context, or you can skip straight to the question-answer format we’ve demonstrated below.

 

How do I format the question and answer sections?

Use a single bold line to state the question as we did above. Phrasing the question as an employee would ask it typically works best.

 

What if I have a longer answer that requires more than one paragraph?

If your answer is significantly longer, that’s okay. You could also think about whether or not it could use its own, more in-depth article that you can link to from a more general FAQ. You could also consider breaking your question up into more than one Q&A.

You can write the question out in a single paragraph or multiple paragraphs below the question. Having the question bolded (or even a larger font size than the answer) helps create some visual separation for longer answers.

 

KBB0010003
Sample Knowledge Block - Restricted Content FAQ

 

What are other formatting considerations I should think about?

Just as with any other knowledge article, you can use the standard knowledge features to present information in a variety of ways.

 

Unordered List

  • Create a list of things for easy scanning
  • If they aren’t in any particular order just use bullets
  • This is a simple way to make info easy to access

 

Ordered List

  1. Use numbers or letters to create a sequenced list
  2. Any steps to follow are a good reason to use ordered lists
  3. Then put them under one of your questions, optionally with a sentence or two before or after for additional context

 

Images

Images are helpful to illustrate information and supplement the text for readers. Make sure your image size is optimized for web.  Often centering the image can help visually when viewing on a desktop or laptop screen.

 

 

 

Table

If you need to display information in a grid, you can use a table in the article as well. Here’s an example of what this might look like.

Article Type Description Other Info 
 How ToProvide guidance through a process or set of steps.Lots of formatting options. May be a variety of lengths.
 FAQA collection of question and answers around a topic.Don’t forget you can use knowledge blocks to address multiple audiences in one article.
 SOPFor HR agents, to follow protocols and policies.More technical and longer. You might have these in a separate knowledge base.

 

 

KBB0010002
Sample Knowledge Block - Reusable Content



Searching with success

Once you have your content planned and created, don’t forget to consider how it will be searched. Add meta tags in the Meta field on the knowledge article to capture the common search words or terms users may use to search for this content. Updating your synonym dictionary can also be useful to help find relevant articles.

 

How can I continue improving my Knowledge content? 

One of the best ways to grow and improve your Knowledge articles is to start by looking at what is coming in via your cases that should really be deflected via knowledge. By analyzing case data, you can identify questions that continue coming in from employees that are gaps—either for new knowledge or improving the information you provide in current articles.

 

]]>General02100-01-01d92fbe0c13098410579076076144b04apublished

sys_update_xml.payload: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="kb_version"><kb_version action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><knowledge display_value="KB0010003">91dcbe8813098410579076076144b07e</knowledge><modified_by display_value="System Administrator">6816f79cc0a8016401c5a33be04be441</modified_by><modified_on>2019-11-06 18:07:20</modified_on><snapshot>6</snapshot><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2019-11-06 17:56:22</sys_created_on><sys_domain>global</sys_domain><sys_id>d92fbe0c13098410579076076144b04a</sys_id><sys_mod_count>2</sys_mod_count><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2019-11-06 18:07:20</sys_updated_on><version>1.0</version></kb_version></record_update>

sys_update_xml.name: kb_knowledge_block_42d7b09613b80010579076076144b0d5
sys_update_xml.payload:
true42d7b09613b80010579076076144b0d5text6816f79cc0a8016401c5a33be04be4414cca6ce8877003001f55c679e7cb0b0cfalsetruetruefalseKBB0010003 v1.0falsefb0330019f22120047a2d126c42e70e5bb0370019f22120047a2d126c42e7073trueHow should I handle questions that are only relevant to certain employees? Knowledge blocks are a greatKBB00100032019-10-31Sample Knowledge Block - Restricted Content FAQaa28749613b80010579076076144b080kb_knowledge_blockadmin2019-10-31 21:37:16global/42d7b09613b80010579076076144b0d57admin2019-10-31 23:30:231How should I handle questions that are only relevant to certain employees?

Knowledge blocks are a great way to include questions that are only relevant to subset of your employees, especially when you need to restrict who can see what. For example, if you have a question for employees only in a certain location, department or job role, who are part of a union, or full-time employees vs. contingent workers, you can create a knowledge block and define who has access to this based on criteria.

Tip: it’s a good idea to include a reference to the criteria this answer applies to in the question. This could be especially useful if you give access to managers of employees who meet the criteria but who don’t meet that criteria themselves. Something like “What is the pay schedule for non-salaried employees in the US?” or “What are the retirement benefits for UK workers?” makes it clear what the specific content is if it’s only a subset of the overall article’s information.

]]>General02100-01-01a302d55e13f80010579076076144b0f9published

sys_update_xml.name: m2m_kb_to_block_history_d77b3e4813098410579076076144b048
sys_update_xml.payload: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update table="m2m_kb_to_block_history"><m2m_kb_to_block_history action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><article_drafted>2019-11-06 17:40:24</article_drafted><article_outdated/><article_published>2019-11-06 17:45:44</article_published><article_retired/><article_state>published</article_state><block_count>1</block_count><block_outdated/><block_published>2019-11-06 17:40:24</block_published><block_retired/><block_state>published</block_state><knowledge display_value="KB0010002">3a3019da13f80010579076076144b07f</knowledge><knowledge_block display_value="KBB0010002">f787309613b80010579076076144b0fc</knowledge_block><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2019-11-06 17:40:24</sys_created_on><sys_id>d77b3e4813098410579076076144b048</sys_id><sys_mod_count>1</sys_mod_count><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2019-11-06 17:45:44</sys_updated_on></m2m_kb_to_block_history></record_update>

sys_update_xml.name: kb_knowledge_6120878c13098410579076076144b0da
sys_update_xml.payload:
true6120878c13098410579076076144b0datext6816f79cc0a8016401c5a33be04be441falsetruefalsefalseKB0010006 v1.0false51fff28c13098410579076076144b055truesop, standard_operating_protocol, policy, procedure, protocol, policies, policies_and_procedures, sop_sample, knowledge_sample, sample_sop, sample_articleOverview Effective Date Issued by Valid up to Reviewed by Revision number and date Implemented by DepartmentKB00100062019-11-06Standard Operating Procedure Knowledge Sample5f41c78c13098410579076076144b040kb_knowledgeadmin2019-11-06 18:05:48global/6120878c13098410579076076144b0da5admin2019-11-06 18:06:212Overview

Effective Date  Issued by
 Valid up to Reviewed by
 Revision number and date Implemented by
 DepartmentIntended Audience

You may also include a table of contents if this is a longer article you want to provide better visibility to without requiring a lot of scrolling.

 

Purpose

An SOP knowledge article is used for knowledge that is internal to the HR team, and helps agents refer to the protocols they follow in their work. The first thing to do in a knowledge article for SOPs is to state its intended purpose. You can highlight any documents this governs, anything this authorizes an HR agent or manager to do, and if there’s an applicable period of time this covers.

 

SOP In a nutshell

Before getting into the details, provide a basic summary of the aspects of the SOP. For example, you might have a summary of steps to follow that are outlined in full under the Procedure section. Or you might have additional contextual information.

  • Summary step 1
  • Summary step 2
  • Summary step 3
    • Additional  detail
    • Additional  detail

If you have a graphic, image, or other data that summarizes or introduces the SOP you can include it here as well.

 

Procedure

This is where you will outline the  specific steps and actions required for this protocol or process.

  1. Write a detailed explanation of the step to follow, with the appropriate level of clarification and details for someone to complete it even if they aren’t very familiar with it.
  2. Write a detailed explanation of the step to follow, with the appropriate level of clarification and details for someone to complete it even if they aren’t very familiar with it.
  3. Write a detailed explanation of the step to follow, with the appropriate level of clarification and details for someone to complete it even if they aren’t very familiar with it.
    • When there’s  extra details needed, include sub bullets
    • When there’s  extra details needed, include sub bullets
    • When there’s  extra details needed, include sub bullets
    • When there’s  extra details needed, include sub bullets
  4. Write a detailed explanation of the step to follow, with the appropriate level of clarification and details for someone to complete it even if they aren’t very familiar with it.
  5. Write a detailed explanation of the step to follow, with the appropriate level of clarification and details for someone to complete it even if they aren’t very familiar with it.
  6. Write a detailed explanation of the step to follow, with the appropriate level of clarification and details for someone to complete it even if they aren’t very familiar with it.
  7. Write a detailed explanation of the step to follow, with the appropriate level of clarification and details for someone to complete it even if they aren’t very familiar with it.
  8. Write a detailed explanation of the step to follow, with the appropriate level of clarification and details for someone to complete it even if they aren’t very familiar with it.
  9. Write a detailed explanation of the step to follow, with the appropriate level of clarification and details for someone to complete it even if they aren’t very familiar with it.
  10. Write a detailed explanation of the step to follow, with the appropriate level of clarification and details for someone to complete it even if they aren’t very familiar with it.

 

Relevant Forms

Form ID000: Form Full Title

Provide a brief description of the form and how it should be used. Then highlight the main details included in the form.

  • Field
  • Field
  • Field
  • Field
  • Field
  • Field

 

Form ID000: Form Full Title

Provide a brief description of the form and how it should be used. Then highlight the main details included in the form.

  • Field
  • Field
  • Field
  • Field
  • Field
  • Field

 

Form ID000: Form Full Title

Provide a brief description of the form and how it should be used. Then highlight the main details included in the form.

  • Field
  • Field
  • Field
  • Field
  • Field
  • Field

 

Frequency of Review

If this SOP’s process or document needs  to be revisited at a certain interval,  explain what that is and how to follow the review process here. For example,  if  someone needs to check for any missing documents and an employee  fails to do so, outline the progress steps to  take if this is  discovered during the review:

  • Progress Action A: When to follow  (e.g. first time)
  • Progress Action B: When to follow  (e.g. second time)
  • Progress Action C: When to follow  (e.g. third time)

 

Relevant Reports

If there are relevant reports that are conducted every so often on this matter, describe what these are and who will create the report, who the audience will be, the expected level of compliance with this SOP, and any key metrics to include or evaluate on. If there’s an external reference to a system or document,  you can include that here as well.

 

HR Systems

  1. List any relevant systems related to this process
  2. If there is more than one you can list them separately
  3. Be sure to explain the reasons or manner for using the system in question as it relates to this process

 

Interpretations

If there are areas to this SOP that may require a degree of interpretation, outline what the HR agent should expect to do. For example, they may discuss it with their manager on a case by case basis or need a more formal review process. You can also include instructions for what you want to be done if there are multiple interpretations, such as escalation process. Or if a possible addition to this SOP is suggested, how that can be submitted for review.

 

Searching with success

Once you have your content planned and created, don’t forget to consider how it will be searched. Add meta tags in the Meta field on the knowledge article to capture the common search words or terms users may use to search for this content. Updating your synonym dictionary can also be useful to help find relevant articles.

 

 

]]>General02100-01-015f610bcc13098410579076076144b099published

sys_update_xml.name: kb_knowledge_block_1412195e13f80010579076076144b02e
sys_update_xml.payload:
true1412195e13f80010579076076144b02etext6816f79cc0a8016401c5a33be04be4414cca6ce8877003001f55c679e7cb0b0cfalsetruetruefalseKBB0010004 v1.0falsefb0330019f22120047a2d126c42e70e5bb0370019f22120047a2d126c42e7073trueUse Knowledge Blocks for targeting info to certain audiences Knowledge blocks are a great way to includeKBB00100042019-10-31Sample Knowledge Block - Restricted Content How Tob732195e13f80010579076076144b002kb_knowledge_blockadmin2019-10-31 23:31:13global/1412195e13f80010579076076144b02e4admin2019-10-31 23:31:151Use Knowledge Blocks for targeting info to certain audiences

Knowledge blocks are a great way to include questions that are only relevant to subset of your employees, especially when you need to restrict who can see what. For example, if you have a question for employees only in a certain location, department or job role, who are part of a union, or full-time employees vs. contingent workers, you can create a knowledge block and define who has access to this based on criteria. As an example, this knowledge block was created to apply to All Employees using HR Criteria.

 

Tip: it’s a good idea to include a reference to the criteria this answer applies to in the question. This could be especially useful if you give access to managers of employees who meet the criteria but who don’t meet that criteria themselves. Something like “The pay schedule for non-salaried employees in the US” or “Retirement benefits for UK workers” makes it clear what the specific content is if it’s only a subset of the overall article’s information.

 

]]>General02100-01-011442995e13f80010579076076144b0e8published

sys_update_xml.payload: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update table="m2m_kb_to_block_history"><m2m_kb_to_block_history action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><article_drafted>2019-11-06 17:56:17</article_drafted><article_outdated/><article_published>2019-11-06 17:56:22</article_published><article_retired/><article_state>published</article_state><block_count>1</block_count><block_outdated/><block_published>2019-11-06 17:56:17</block_published><block_retired/><block_state>published</block_state><knowledge display_value="KB0010003">91dcbe8813098410579076076144b07e</knowledge><knowledge_block display_value="KBB0010002">f787309613b80010579076076144b0fc</knowledge_block><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2019-11-06 17:56:17</sys_created_on><sys_id>371f3a0c13098410579076076144b02e</sys_id><sys_mod_count>1</sys_mod_count><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2019-11-06 17:56:22</sys_updated_on></m2m_kb_to_block_history></record_update>

sys_update_xml.name: kb_knowledge_3a3019da13f80010579076076144b07f
sys_update_xml.payload:
true3a3019da13f80010579076076144b07ftext6816f79cc0a8016401c5a33be04be441falsefalsefalsefalseKB0010002 v1.0falsefb0330019f22120047a2d126c42e70e5bb0370019f22120047a2d126c42e7073truehow_to, how_to_guide, process_overview, how_to_sample, knowledge_sample, sample_guide, sample_how_to, sample_articleTable of Contents This can be useful if your guide has several sections Use subheadings Call to actionKB00100022019-11-06How to Guide Knowledge Sample5f60d9da13f80010579076076144b06bkb_knowledgeadmin2019-10-31 23:23:16global/3a3019da13f80010579076076144b07f11admin2019-11-06 17:45:442Table of Contents

This can be useful if your guide has several sections

  • Use subheadings
  • Call to action
  • Mix it up with images
  • Bulleted Lists
  • Numbered Lists
  • More Ideas
  • Reusable knowledge block

 

Use subheadings

These make your knowledge articles more scannable. Ideally, they’re short and to the point.

This can be a useful way to break up steps in a process that require more detail and explanation within each step. In this case, you can choose to number them in the subheading, or just create some really great content headlines. We’ll show you a few ideas below.

 

Choose a Call to action

If your article requires the user to take an action like submitting a request or using another tool, make sure to call out how to do this. Simple phrases that tell the reader what they should do work best. You can also use things like spacing, bolded text, colors, or indentations to make it stand out visually. If your article is long, you may consider doing this at the top as well as the bottom of the article.

Tip: make sure the action you mention is actionable. If there’s a catalog item or another website to go to, link to it using hyperlink text. Take the guess work out of it for the reader.

 

READ MORE!

 

Mix it up with Images

Embedding an image in your knowledge article can be a great aid to illustrate a process or provide visual interest. Images you might use could include screenshots you take yourself if you’re trying to show a step in a system like your HCM, or it could be branded imagery from your company or images you got from a stock site that follow the theme of what you’re discussing.

 

 

Usually, a .jpg or .png file optimized for web will work best. Setting a maximum width of around 500 or 600 pixels works well for horizontal images. You might want to set a narrower width for horizontal images depending on how long they are, or how much space you want them to take up visually. Typically, a centered image looks nice on the page and makes things very readable.

Be sure to partner with your brand and communications team, and if you use stock images make sure to get the right license for the type of use you need. Many stock image sites offer royalty-free options for certain types of usage.

 

KBB0010004
Sample Knowledge Block - Restricted Content How To

 

Bulleted lists

This helps highlight info in a succinct way, such as things someone needs to know before they begin. Here’s an example of tips to keep in mind to write articles that are easy to understand

  • Write for the average user
  • Be straightforward, avoid technical jargon
  • Cater to different kinds of learners
  • Break information up into small chunks

 

Numbered lists

Use these when you have very short, ordered steps that only require a . For example,

  1. First determine what question you’re trying to answer
  2. Then outline the steps you need to accomplish
  3. Call out any possible gotchas users might not know about
  4. Note: you can add a brief tip for common questions that might come up

 

More Ideas

Looking for even more ways to create effective knowledge content? Here’s a few things we  do when we want to get inspired:

  • Our Content: take a look at the out of box content we deliver in the product, such as our Employee Journeys. We typically provide sample knowledge articles you can use as an idea of how to structure different types of information around certain topics.
  • Your favorite site: you’re a reader in your everyday life, so think about some favorite websites or brands you love and take a look at their customer-facing support sites. Chances are there’s some overall structure, tone, or ideas you could use in your own knowledge even if the topics are pretty different.
  • Keep it simple: even though you may be dealing with a complex topic and you’re an expert on all the ins-and-outs, put yourself in the shoes of someone who isn’t. Start with plain language, and the simple steps in your first draft. You can always add more detail.
  • Ask for feedback: if you have some folks around the office who aren’t experts on this article’s topic, you can do an informal poll and ask people for feedback before publishing. Ask them what questions they still have after reading it, or to repeat back in their own words what they learned.  This could give you great insights on ways to revise the article before publishing.

 

KBB0010002
Sample Knowledge Block - Reusable Content

 

Searching with success

Once you have your content planned and created, don’t forget to consider how it will be searched. Add meta tags in the Meta field on the knowledge article to capture the common search words or terms users may use to search for this content. Updating your synonym dictionary can also be useful to help find relevant articles.

 

 

]]>General02100-01-0159bc3e8813098410579076076144b068published
